pullRequest.body:
Rename `cardinal_mk` in lemma names to `cardinalMk` to follow the naming convention.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [7debd8dde4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18808/commits/7debd8dde4e88657f1e5d1fdf53a68ef17485a9f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.Set.Subsingleton.cardinalMk_le_one`
`+ aleph0_le_cardinalMk_of_charZero`
`+ cardinalMk_algHom`
`+ cardinalMk_algHom_le_rank`
`+ cardinalMk_closure`
`+ cardinalMk_closure_le_max`
`+ cardinalMk_eq_cardinalMk_field_pow_rank`
`+ cardinalMk_eq_lift`
`+ cardinalMk_eq_max_lift`
`+ cardinalMk_eq_sum`
`+ cardinalMk_eq_sum_lift`
`+ cardinalMk_le_finrank`
`+ cardinalMk_le_max_aleph0_of_finite`
`+ cardinalMk_le_max_aleph0_of_finite'`
`+ cardinalMk_le_mul`
`+ cardinalMk_le_of_le`
`+ cardinalMk_le_of_le'`
`+ cardinalMk_le_sigma_polynomial`
`+ cardinalMk_lift_le_max`
`+ cardinalMk_lift_le_mul`
`+ cardinalMk_lift_of_infinite`
`+ cardinalMk_of_countable_of_charZero`
`+ cardinalMk_of_infinite`
`+ lift_cardinalMk_eq_lift_cardinalMk_field_pow_lift_rank`
`++ cardinalMk_eq_max`
`++++ cardinalMk_le_max`
`++++---- cardinal_mk_le_max`
`++-- cardinal_mk_eq_max`
`- _root_.Set.Subsingleton.cardinal_mk_le_one`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

@b-mehta Did you see @eric-wieser 's suggestion on Zulip to rename it to something with `card` in name? I suggest that we make a decision first to avoid 2 renames in a row. @YaelDillies or @eric-wieser , could you please start a discussion in a public Zulip channel?
bors d-
The fact that `#α` is precisely the constructor of `Cardinal` applied to `α` is not really intuitive unless you're aware of it. I'd also prefer that we simply rename these theorems to use `card`.

> Did you see @eric-wieser 's suggestion on Zulip to rename it to something with `card` in name? I suggest that we make a decision first to avoid 2 renames in a row.

Yes I saw, but this is a much bigger rename than the one at hand, which is why I would rather do this one first. I have started [a Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Cardinal.2Emk) anyway.
@eric-wieser WDYT?

Eric says that he had no intention to block, so I'm re-delegating it. @YaelDillies , sorry for a delay caused by my misunderstanding.
bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge
Sorry to delay this even further, but I do have one ask.
bors d+
bors d+
Sorry to delay this even further, but I do have one ask.
Please add a deprecated alias for this one.

It'd be nice to get rid of the prime here. The general convention for theorems about `lift` seems to be to just suffix the name by `lift` if it can't be inserted anywhere more appropriate. So in this case:
```suggestion
theorem cardinalMk_eq_sum_lift : #(WType β) = sum (fun a : α => #(WType β) ^ lift.{u} #(β a)) :=
```
Note also that the parentheses around `fun` are not needed (and `=>` can be turned into `↦`).

pullRequest.title: chore: camel `cardinal_mk`

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add results on cardinality of localization
